page.title: 18OUR DOOMSDAY PROJECT
page.content: {The contributions to this block were {drawn from William Austin Junior, {Richmond Hill Special, and Stopsley {High Schools. Class 2C & 2E of William Austin junior school went out twice to survey the land use of their area. We found that out of 1592 houses, 123 had extensions built. There were 116 detached houses, 1077 semi-detached houses, 119 bungalows and 230 terraced houses. Of the 1592 houses we found 653 were built of bricks, 637 were part brick, part pebbledash, 148 houses had a stucco finish, 141 were all pebbledash and 13 were mock stone cladded. There were 1320 houses with tiles on the roof and 272 with slates. 1375 homes had retained their front garden but 214 had changed them into a car parking space. 1047 houses had a garage.
